intro: Niota tetrapetala, commonly known as the four-petaled niota, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, four-petaled flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a velvety texture. Niota tetrapetala is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
